aboutUs.title: Overview
aboutUs.subDesc1: We are a company that transforms electrical energy into light using efficient technology.
aboutUs.subDesc2: We gain 80% of all knowledge and information from light.
aboutUs.aboutCompanyTit:
Global leader in LED technology, 
Writing a new history with light.
aboutUs.aboutCompanyTitSub: We are a global LED company based on the World 1
aboutUs.aboutCompanyText1: Seoul Viosys is a full-line solution provider for UV LED, VCSEL (Vertical Cavity Surface Emitting Laser), the next-generation light source for 3D sensors and lasers and a single-pixel RGB “WICOP Pixel” for displays.
aboutUs.aboutCompanyText2: Established in 2002 as a subsidiary of Seoul Semiconductor, it captured the leading market share in the UV LED industry (LEDinside, 2018). Seoul Viosys has an extensive UV LED portfolio with all wavelength ranges (200nm to 1600nm) including ultraviolet rays (UV), visible rays and infrared rays. It possesses more than 4,000 patents related to UV LED technology. Violeds, its flagship UV LED technology, provides a wide range of industries with optimal solutions for strong sterilization and disinfection (UVC), skin regeneration (UVB), water/air purification and effective cultivation for horticulture.
aboutUs.aboutCompanyText3: In 2018, Seoul Viosys acquired RayCan, a leading optoelectronic specialist, to add the advanced VCSEL technology which supports smartphone facial recognition and autonomous driving, and has begun mass production.

founderMessage.title: Founder's Message
founderMessage.label:
For a new history of light! 
And a world without technology theft
founderMessage.labelMo: For a new history of light! And a world without technology theft
founderMessage.statement: Every day we reflect on the day's work and keep moving forward one step at a time to adhere to our principles and create value for our valued customers who share values with us.
founderMessage.subDesc:
With the goal of “making the world cleaner, healthier, and safer with light,” Seoul Viosys has grown from a rental factory on a commercial street - by turning crises into opportunities - into the world's only company that has second-generation technologies in the LED industry to produce optical semiconductor LEDs of all wavelengths, from 20nm UV to 1400nm laser diodes, without wire, package and lens, which are essential elements of semiconductors. 

We will strive more vigorously to provide mankind good light – a healthy light that prevents myopia onset with natural light, a clean light that clears viruses and bacteria from the air and water, a memory-improving light, a light that reproduces natural colors and a light that helps you have a good night's sleep.

In my 20s when Jimmy Carter, a son of a farmer, became President of the United States, I asked myself “What about me?” as I was also born the youngest son of a farmer. Just as this was a turning point in my life, I hope that the journey of a company that started business in Korea but has grown to become a global manufacturer will be a small but sure hope for young people. 

Just as intellectual property motivated the world to spark the First, Second, and Third Industrial Revolutions, reducing the proportion of the world's population in absolute poverty from 85% to less than 9%, giving people light by which people obtain 80% of information, lowering the illiteracy rate from 90% to the 10% range and leading people to a safer life, and reducing infant mortality from 44% to less than 4%, respecting and honoring intellectual property rights will give hope to young people, accelerate creative innovations, make human life better, and create a fair society where people can move between social classes. To help make this hope a reality, I keep creating new works and fighting for intellectual property, vowing not to cut my hair until I have won each battle. 

Please show your continuous interest in us and keep encouraging us in the future.

sustainableManagement.desc: We create sustainable future in consideration of both business and environment.
sustainableManagement.subDesc: As a company that delivers happiness through light,

complianceManagement.title: Law observance management
complianceManagement.subDesc1: We believe that businesses have meaning and value of existence only when they do not violate law and ethics in the world where people live. As a result, Seoul Viosys operates under the mission of “A company that constantly grows by providing pride to its employees, value creation to customers, stability to shareholders and helping the world.” In addition, Seoul Viosys will continue to ractice crystal management in accordance with the law and ethics as always.

environmental.desc: Seoul Viosys recognizes corporate responsibility for climate change and resource issues, and practices systematic environmental management to minimize environmental impact.

subDesc.desc1: We focus on four strategic pillars

boldList.item4: and building a resource circulation foundation.

subDesc.desc2: Through these, we systematically manage environmental risks and continuously improve environmental performance.
subDesc.desc4: By expanding low-carbon and eco-friendly technologies and implementing company-wide environmental responsibility management, we fulfill our responsibility as a leading global LED company committed to sustainability.

productEnvironment.sub1Desc1: Seoul Viosys Co., Ltd. is striving to put in the following efforts for creation of corporate values and earth environment preservation under the principle that fulfilling our environmental and social responsibilities is of the foremost priority and value.
productEnvironment.sub1Desc2:
1. Set and announce the purposes and goals within the technologically and economically feasible ranges for accomplishment of product environment policies, and promote activities for realizations thereof.
2. Pursue compliance of domestic and overseas product environment related laws and regulations, and set and independently manage the improved and enhanced standards for the preservation of earth environment.
3. Provide overall information on product environment to all the staffs and executives, and entice them to realize their respective responsibilities through thorough education and training.
4. Determine the validity of the product environment management system by executing regular review by the management and internal environment evaluation of the system.

environmentalSafety.title: Social
environmentalSafety.sub1Desc1: Seoul Viosys places the utmost priority on the safety and health of its employees and practices systematic occupational safety and health management.
environmentalSafety.sub1Desc2:
We strengthen cooperative safety initiatives, improve working environments, and operate health management programs to ensure a healthy and safe workplace for all employees. In addition, we enhance chemical management systems to proactively identify and control workplace hazards.

Going forward, Seoul Viosys will continue to comply fully with occupational safety and health laws and regulations, while working with our partners to promote a strong safety culture.
environmentalSafety.subDesc2: Seoul Viosys conducts the safety environment diagnosis for all production sites and in-house partners on a regular basis through consulting with specialized companies in the safety, environment, energy, and health sectors. Participating in the “Safety and Health Coexistence Cooperation Program” organized by the Ministry of Labor, we provide safety and health support and training to our partners on a regular basis, and have achieved Grade A in 2015 in recognition for our contribution. On the other hand, we map and index the risks of all business sites to use them as a measure of risk management.
environmentalSafety.sub3: Employee health management and work environment improvement
environmentalSafety.sub3Desc1: Seoul Viosys operates annual employee health checkups and various health promotion programs for employees’ health management. A professional health doctor supports health consultation to high-risk groups with four major diseases (hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia, and liver disease) for thorough aftercare. We also investigated job stress by task to intensively manage the high stress group.
environmentalSafety.sub3Desc2: In addition, we installed an automatic ventricular defibrillator in case of an emergency and selected emergency rescue personnel for each floor to provide CPR training. We are also making efforts to improve the working environment of our employees. We measure the working environment and improve the working environment twice a year. Seoul Viosys will continue to carry out various health promotion and working environment improvement activities.
environmentalSafety.subDesc4: Seoul Viosys operates OHC (Our healthcare committee) through collaboration with domestic and international experts to improve the company's health management index and to enhance the diagnostic / prophylactic assessment of working environment above legal level and management level. In addition, we operate an OHC room equipped with body composition analyzers, blood glucose meters, and blood pressure devices to help prevent and manage chronic diseases of SSC / SVC employees and employees of internal partners.
environmentalSafety.subDesc5: Seoul Viosys has introduced a pre-environmental safety review system to review the risks beforehand on all substances used in the workplace. All chemicals used in our company cannot be used without a pre-risk review. All chemical handling equipment must go through the process of installation inspection, minimizing the risk that may occur. In addition, we are strengthening monitoring and conducting emergency response and training on a regular basis to prevent accidents related to chemicals.
environmentalSafety.subDesc6:
Seoul Viosys is committed to ensuring sustainability across its entire supply chain and practices responsible management in line with global standards. To this end, we have established and operate the Seoul Viosys Supplier Code of Conduct. 
This Code of Conduct is based on global guidelines such as the UN Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights, and the RBA Code of Conduct, and serves as the standard for supply chain sustainability management.

We require mandatory agreements with our major partners regarding compliance with the Code of Conduct, and we continuously monitor adherence through new vendor assessments, regular evaluations, and supply chain risk reviews. Updates to global standards are also reflected in our Code, ensuring that our partners are supported in fulfilling their social and environmental responsibilities while practicing ethical business conduct.

codeOfConduct.title: Code of Conduct
codeOfConduct.sub1: Seoul Viosys Code of Conduct Ver. 1.0
codeOfConduct.subDesc1:
Seoul Viosys thinks that all workers have the right to work in safe and ethical working conditions. We also understand the importance of responsible corporate operations that can minimize environmental impact. Therefore, Seoul Viosys and its partners are striving to achieve social and environmental performance.

As part of such efforts, this Code of Conduct (hereinafter referred to as the “Code”) summarizes and presents the requirements of Seoul Viosys and its partners. The application of the Code includes any form of organization that designs, sells, manufactures or provides parts and services used to produce products. All employees and members should comply with the Code and require all sub-supply chains providing assembly, parts, raw materials and packaging in the relevant business area to comply with it.

The party is solely responsible for complying with the Code, and appropriate sanctions may be imposed if the remedial action is not taken within the time limit.

This Code is based on the RBA Code of Conduct Version 7.0 (2021) and reflects the requirements of our clients. In addition, the Code may be revised according to changes in internal and external management policies and standards.
codeOfConduct.desc1:
∙ No discrimination in employment due to worker's age, physical disability, ethnicity, gender, marital status, nationality, political orientation, race, homosexuality, or membership in labor association.  
∙ Pregnancy and medical reports should not be required unless legal or related to workplace safety concerns.
∙ Prohibition of inappropriate discrimination based on the result of medical reports.
codeOfConduct.desc2:
∙ Prohibition of harassment and assault in the workplace.
∙ Prohibition of threats by inhuman treatment such as verbal abuse, assault, mental violence, mental / physical coercion, and sexual harassment.
codeOfConduct.label3: Prevention of Involuntary Labor and Human Trafficking
codeOfConduct.desc3:
∙ Guarantee voluntary labor. 
∙ Prohibition of trafficking or forced labor of any kind.
∙ Involuntary labor includes exile, stealth, recruitment, transfer, acquisition, or threatening, pressure, coercion, abduction, hijacking, or fraudulent recruitment or payment to control the other party. 
∙ Prohibition of worker’s government issued ID or travel related documents. 
∙ The contract with the worker should ensure that the terms of employment are clearly written in a language that the worker can understand. 
∙ Prohibition of improper restrictions on entry and exit and transfer to and from the workplace.
∙ Ensuring that third-party recruitment agencies conduct activities consistent with the provisions of the law and the Code.
∙ The supplier is responsible for any unpaid salary exceeding one month of a third party or directly hired overseas contractor workers.
codeOfConduct.desc4:
∙ Employment of legally employable adolescents, but any work that harms health, stability and mentality should not be assigned to workers aged 18 or younger based on ILO
∙ Minimum Age Convention No. 138. Prohibition of juvenile workers of overtime or night work
codeOfConduct.desc5:
∙ Ensure proper management of student workers through legally guaranteed student human rights protection, efforts as an educational partner and school life.
∙ Providing appropriate support and training
codeOfConduct.desc6:
∙ Working time is limited to 60 hours per week including overtime. 
∙ Workers should have at least a day off per week, except for emergencies or abnormal situations.
∙ Must comply with laws and regulations regarding working hours and overtime must be voluntary
codeOfConduct.label7: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
codeOfConduct.desc7:
∙ As a legal permission, the supplier allows collective bargaining without interference, discrimination, retaliation or assault and also allows workers to establish and join associations. 
∙ Working time is limited to 60 hours per week including overtime. Ensure a mechanism for workers to report complaints and enable open conversation between labor and management
codeOfConduct.desc8:
∙ Ensure that all workers receive legal minimum salary and benefits. 
∙ Provide holidays, annual leave, and legal holidays. 
∙ Compensation for legally specified overtime pay. 
∙ Discuss payment structure and payment period with all workers.
∙ Pay the exact salary at the right time. 
∙ Pay cuts should not be used in a disciplined way.

governance.title: Governance
governance.sub1desc1: Seoul Viosys recognizes that ethical and transparent business practices are the foundation for sustainable growth. We are committed to strict compliance with laws and principles in all aspects of our operations.
governance.sub1desc2:
Based on domestic and international laws, global standards, and internal regulations, we are fostering a strong compliance culture across the company. Our efforts include reinforcing employee conduct standards, preventing risks related to anti-corruption, fair trade, and intellectual property protection, and ensuring transparent decision-making processes.

To further solidify our commitment, Seoul Viosys has established a Compliance Declaration that embodies the ethical responsibility and dedication of all employees.
governance.sub2desc1: Seoul Viosys ensures responsible decision-making and sustainable management based on the independence and expertise of its Board.
governance.sub2desc2: The Board plays a central role in setting strategic directions, reviewing key business issues, and overseeing ESG-related matters. It also strengthens internal committees and audit systems to uphold transparent and sound corporate governance.
governance.sub3desc1: Seoul Viosys provides timely and regular disclosures to ensure transparent communication of key management information to stakeholders.

conflictMinerals.title: Conflict minerals
conflictMinerals.subDesc1: As part of economic sanctions to eradicate social issues such as infringements upon personal rights, exploitation of child labor and sexual assault in African conflict areas (10 countries including DR Congo), countries around developed countries have designated four major minerals (3TG: tin, tungsten, tantalum, and gold) that are mined in these regions as conflict minerals, and prohibit companies from using conflict minerals to prevent mining funds from flowing into military funds of rebels.
conflictMinerals.subDesc2: Seoul Viosys recognizes the importance of selecting and monitoring suppliers to ensure sustainable management. Strict regulations are applied to Seoul Viosys’s suppliers to avoid importing minerals produced in conflict areas (especially the Democratic Republic of Congo). The regulations on the selection and monitoring of these suppliers are defined as external purchase policies and are constantly being revised

brandLogo.sub:
The smaller and larger circles represent the earth and the universe, respectively with the connection between the two representing the value of unity and single-mindedness.

The color is green to represents the natural environment.

The connection of the two circles conveys the sense of throbbing movement and great ambition that the small steps of development by Seoul Viosys will proliferate throughout the whole world and humanity to make us known everywhere in the universe, just as a stone thrown into a calm lake causes small ripples that spread throughout the entire lake.​

financeInfo.title: Financial Information
financeInfo.mainDesc:
Seoul Viosys operates three consolidated subsidiaries located in the United States, Vietnam, and China. Leveraging global R&D and manufacturing infrastructure, the company provides total optical solutions ranging from UV, Blue, Green, Red, IR, and VCSEL chips to modules for customers worldwide. Seoul Viosys holds a broad portfolio of optical semiconductors covering the full wavelength spectrum from 200nm to 1400nm, including the world’s first no-wire RGB 1-chip micro LED display, backed by approximately 6,000 patents.​

​
financeInfo.descMore: We expect to further strengthen our position by expanding our product lines to the fast growing 3D sensing markets via our VCSEL technology and by addressing the $100 billion micro display market with our differentiated WICOP technology.

stockInfo.sub1_1: The purpose of this Regulation is to stipulate issues related to the comprehensive management and appropriate disclosure, etc. of internal information of Seoul Viosys Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as the “Company“) in order to ensure prompt and accurate public announcement and to prevent insider trading by executive officers and employees in accordance with the [Act on the Capital Market and Financial Investment Business (hereinafter referred to as the “Act“)] and other overall laws and regulations.
stockInfo.sub1_2:
① The term “inside information“ in this Regulation refers to the obligations for public announcement under Section 1 of the KOSDAQ Market Public Announcement Regulations (hereinafter referred to as the “Public Announcement Regulations“) and other issues that may have a significant impact on the Company's management or property situation, or investors' judgment on making investment.
② Under this Regulation, the “personnel responsible for public announcement“ refers to a person who is authorized to perform reporting duties on behalf of the Company pursuant to Paragraph 4 of Article 2 of the Public Announcement Regulations.
③ Under this Regulation, “executive“ refers to a director (including a person corresponding to any 1 of the items of Clause 1 of Article 401-2 of the [Commercial Act] and an auditor.
④ Under this Regulations, “specified securities, etc.“ refer to specified securities referred to in Clause 1 of Article 172 of the Act including securities issued by the Company, securities depository certificate, convertible bonds that can be exchanged for securities or securities depository certificate and financial investment instruments based on securities, etc.
⑤ The definitions of terms used in this Regulation other than those specified in Paragraphs ① through ④ shall be in accordance with the definitions of terms used in relevant laws and regulations.
stockInfo.sub1_3: Issues related to public announcement, insider trading and internal information management shall be in compliance with this Regulation, except for those stipulated by relevant laws and regulations or the Articles of Incorporation.
stockInfo.sub2_1:
① Executives and staffs shall strictly manage the internal information of the Company that they come to know in the course of their duties and shall not disclose them internally or externally, except when necessary for business purposes.
② The CEO shall take necessary measures to manage internal information, including establishment of specific standards for the storage, delivery and destruction of internal information and related documents, etc.
stockInfo.sub2_2:
① The CEO shall designate a personnel responsible for public announcement and report it to the Korea Exchange. The same shall apply when the personnel responsible for public announcement is changed.
② The personnel responsible for public announcement shall take overall charge of tasks related to the establishment and operation of the internal information management system, and shall perform each of the following tasks to establish an efficient internal information delivery system.
	1. Execution of public announcement.
	2. Inspection and evaluation of the operation status of the internal information management system.
	3. Reviewing the internal information and deciding whether to disclose them or not.
	4. Take necessary measures for the operation of the internal information management system, such as education for executives and staffs.
	5. Directing and supervising departments or executives and staffs in charge of managing internal information or disclosing internal information.
	6. Establishment of a system for delivery of information to the largest shareholders.
	7. Establishment of a system for delivery of information to subsidiary and affiliated companies at all times.
	8. Other tasks recognized by the CEO as necessary for the operation of the internal information management system.
③ The personnel responsible for public announcement shall have the following authorities in performing his/her duties.
	1. The authority to request the submission of various documents and records related to internal information and to view them.
	2. The authority to obtain necessary opinions from executives and staffs of the department in charge of accounting or auditing and other departments in charge of tasks related to the generation of internal information.
	3. The authority to require subsidiary companies to submit necessary information related to public announcement works.
	4. When receiving a request for disclosure of company-related information from shareholders and interested parties, the authority to review the legality of the corresponding request to confirm whether to provide the information and to obtain the opinion of an external legal expert.
④ The personnel responsible for public announcement may consult with executives in charge of related tasks as necessary to fulfill his/her duties and may seek expert assistance at the Company's expense.
⑤ The Personnel responsible for public announcement shall regularly report the operation of the internal information management system to the CEO (or the Board of Directors).
stockInfo.label2_3: Article 6 (Personnel in Charge of Public Announcement)
stockInfo.sub2_3:
① The CEO shall designate the personnel in charge of public announcement and report it to the Korea Exchange. The same shall apply when the personnel in charge of public announcement is changed.
② The personnel in charge of public announcement shall be under the direction of the personnel responsible for public announcement in relation to internal information management and shall perform the following tasks:
	1. Collect and review internal information, and report to personnel responsible for public announcement.
	2. Tasks necessary for the execution of public announcement
	3. Confirm issues necessary for the management of internal information, such as changes in the laws and regulations related to public announcements, and reporting them to the personnel responsible for public announcement.
	4. Routinely monitor the contents of press releases related to the company and report to the personnel responsible for public announcement with contents that are different from the facts in order to correct such inaccuracies.
	5. Other issues deemed necessary by the CEO or personnel responsible for public announcement.
stockInfo.sub2_4:
Executives and heads of departments shall provide information that correspond to any of the following to the personnel responsible for public announcement in a timely manner:
	1. In the event of generation of internal information; and
	2. When there is occurrence of reasons to cancel or change issues among the internal information that have already been announced publicly; and
	3. If there is any other request from the personnel responsible for public announcement.
stockInfo.sub2_5:
① If an executive or a staff needs to provide internal information inevitably to the Company's business partners, external auditors, agents or persons who have entered into advisory contracts with the Company, such as legal advice or management advice, for business purposes, he/she shall report the relevant issues to the person responsible for public announcement. The person responsible for public announcement shall then take the necessary caution not to omit the corresponding information if it is subject to fair public announcement.
② In the case of paragraph ①, the personnel responsible for public announcement shall take necessary measures, such as entering into an agreement on the confidentiality of relevant internal information, etc.
stockInfo.title3: Chapter 3. Public announcement of Internal Information
stockInfo.sub3_1:
The Company's public announcements shall be classified as follows.
	1. Reporting and public announcement pursuant of key management issues pursuant to Clause 1 of Chapter 2 of Section 1 of the Public Announcement Regulation.
	2. Public announcement of inquiries pursuant to Clause 2 of Article 2 of Section 1 of the Public Announcement Regulation
	3. Fair public announcement pursuant to Clause 3 of Chapter 2 of Section 1 of the Public Announcement Regulation
	4. Autonomous public announcement pursuant to Chapter 3 of Section 1 of the Public Announcement Regulation
	5. Submission of securities reports, etc. pursuant to Chapter 1 of Section 3 of the Act
	6. Submission of business reports, etc. pursuant to Articles 159, 160 and 165 of the Act and Clause 4 of Chapter 2 of Section 1 of the Public Announcement Regulation
	7. Submission of a report of key issues pursuant to Article 161 of the Act
	8. Public announcement pursuant to Clause 1 of Article 10 1 of the Public Announcement Regulation
	9. Other public announcement in accordance with other laws and regulations
stockInfo.sub3_2:
① The personnel in charge of public announcement shall report to personnel responsible for public announcement when issues for public announcement stipulated in the Article 9 occur, by preparing the necessary contents and attaching necessary documents.
② The personnel responsible for public announcement shall review whether the contents and documents in Paragraph ① do not violate any relevant laws and regulations, and report the finding to the CEO before making a public announcement.
③ In the event of occurrence of information for public announcement, such public announcement shall be made in a timely manner for the issues that require public announcement.
stockInfo.sub3_3: The personnel responsible for public announcement and the personnel in charge of public announcement shall take measures to correct any errors or omissions in the contents of the public announcement made without delay if such exist.
stockInfo.sub3_4:
① If there is a request for coverage of the Company from the media, the CEO or the personnel responsible for public announcement shall respond to such request in principle. If necessary, an executive and a staff of the relevant departments may be instructed to respond to such request for media coverage.
② If the Company wishes to distribute a press release to the media, the person responsible for public announcement shall be consulted for the purpose. The personnel responsible for public announcement shall report issues related to the distribution of the press release to the CEO if necessary.
③ Any executive or staff who came to realize that the contents of a press release are different from the relevant facts shall report such finding to the personnel responsible for public announcement. The personnel responsible for public announcement shall report the relevant issue to the CEO and take necessary measures.
④ If the contents of the press release correspond to fair public announcement, the contents shall be publicly announced before the press release is distributed.
stockInfo.sub3_5:
① Company presentation on the Company's management details, and business plans and prospects, etc. shall be held in consultation with the personnel responsible for public announcement.
② It must be recognized that making company presentation is a management responsibility and obligation of a listed corporation, and efforts shall be put in to ensure that voluntary and continuous company presentations are made.
③ During the course of making company presentation, care must be taken not to disclose issues that have not been fairly announced publicly in advance.
stockInfo.title4: Chapter 4. Regulations on Insider Trading, etc.
stockInfo.sub4_1:
① Executives, and staffs stipulated in Clause 1 of Article 172 of the Act and Article 194 of the Enforcement Decree of the Act, in the event of having acquired gains by purchasing specified securities, etc. referred to in Clause 1 of Article 172 of the Act then selling them within six months, or by selling the said specified securities and then purchasing them within six months, shall return such gain (hereinafter referred to as “gains from short-term trading“) to the Company.
② If a shareholder of the Company (including a person who owns equity securities or securities depository certificates other than the stock certificates, and same applies hereinafter in this Article) requests the Company to request the person who has obtained gain from short-term trading pursuant to Paragraph ① above to return such gain, the Company shall take necessary measures within two months from the date of receipt of the said request.
③ If the Securities and Futures Commission notifies the Company of the occurrence of gain from short-term trading pursuant to Paragraph ① above, the personnel responsible for public announcement shall, without delay, make a public announcement on the internet website of the Company of the following issues:
	1. The status of the person who is required to return the gain from short-term trading; and
	2. The amount of the gain from short-term trading; and
	3. The date of notification of the fact of occurrence of gain from short-term trading by the Securities and Futures Commission; and
	4. The plan for claiming the return of the gain from short-term trading; and
	5. A shareholder of the Company may request the Company to make a claim for the return of the gain from short-term trading from the person who obtained such gain, and, if the Company does not make such claim within two months from the date of receipt of the request, the said shareholder may make the said claim on behalf of the Company.
④ The period for making the public announcement of the Paragraph ③ above shall be two years from the date of notification of the fact of occurrence of gain from short-term trading by the Securities and Futures Commission or the date of return of the gain from short-term trading, whichever comes first.
stockInfo.label4_2: Article 15 (Notification of Trading of Specific Securities, etc.)
stockInfo.sub4_2:
① Executives, and staffs stipulated in Clause 1 of Article 172 of the Act and Article 194 of the Enforcement Decree of the Act, in the event of engaging in the trading of specific securities and other transactions, shall notify such fact to the personnel responsible for public announcement.
② Executives (including non-registered executives), in the event of owning or trading specific securities of our Company, shall notify the personnel responsible for public announcement or personnel in charge of public announcement of the relevant details within two days.
stockInfo.label4_3: Article 16 (Prohibition of Use of Undisclosed Material Information)
stockInfo.sub4_3:
Executives and staffs shall not use or cause others to use undisclosed material information (including undisclosed material information of affiliated companies) stipulated in Clause 1 of Article 174 of the Act for the trading of specific securities or other transactions.

※ The Company may register with the “Insider trading notification service of staffs and executives of listed corporations (KRX-Insider Trading Alarm Service)“ provided by the Korea Exchange for the prevention of unfair transactions such as prohibiting the use of undisclosed information by insiders, etc. and returning gains from short-term trading profits, etc., and reporting of shareholdings, and may utilize it for notification and reporting of issues stipulated in Articles 14 to 16.
stockInfo.label4_4: Article 17 (Internal Material Information of Affiliated Companies, etc.)
stockInfo.sub4_4:
① Staffs and executives shall strictly manage the undisclosed material information of the Company's affiliated companies that they come to know of in the course of their work, and shall not disclose or divulge them internally or externally, except when necessary for business purposes.
② If staffs and executives come to be aware of the undisclosed material information of affiliated companies, they shall not use the information or cause others to use it.
stockInfo.sub5_1: The personnel responsible for public announcement and the personnel in charge of public announcement shall complete education and training on public announcement works pursuant to Article 36 and Clause 5 of Article 44 of the Public Announcement Regulation, and the personnel responsible for public announcement shall inform the contents of education and training to the relevant executives and staffs of the Company.
stockInfo.label5_2: Article 19 (Amendment and Abolishment of the Regulation)
stockInfo.sub5_2: Amendment or abolition of this Regulation shall be through the resolution of the Board of Directors.
stockInfo.sub5_3:
This Regulation shall be proclaimed on the website of the Company. The same shall apply when amendments to the Regulation are made.

※ Supplementary Provisions
This Regulation will be implemented from December 16, 2020.

wicop.introduction:
WICOP (Wafer Integrated Chip on PCB) is a technology that involves mounting the chip directly onto the substrate without using wires or packages. 
This method eliminates the traditional packaging steps, allowing for a slimmer design
wicop.introductionMobile:
WICOP (Wafer Integrated Chip on PCB) is a technology that involves mounting the chip directly onto the substrate without using wires or packages. 
This method eliminates the traditional packaging steps, allowing for a slimmer design

WICOPCharacteristic.title: High Light Efficiency
WICOPCharacteristic.item: By minimizing optical loss, it provides high light efficiency and output.
WICOPCharacteristic.item_1: It can achieve excellent color rendering and uniform light distribution.
WICOPCharacteristic.item2: With low thermal resistance and excellent heat dissipation, it offers high reliability.
WICOPCharacteristic.item2_1: It has superior resistance to thermal shock and mechanical stress.
WICOPCharacteristic.title3: Flexible and Slim Design and Applicability
WICOPCharacteristic.item3: As an ultra-thin LED mounted directly on the substrate, it allows for designs in various shapes and sizes.
WICOPCharacteristic.item3_1: It can be utilized in various fields such as automotive, displays, lighting, and home appliances.
WICOPCharacteristic.item4: By minimizing the materials and energy used in the manufacturing process, it reduces the environmental impact.

acrich.introduction:
Acrich is a portmanteau of AC and rich, referring to AC Direct driving technology 
that utilizes high-voltage MJT (Multi Junction Technology) LED technology and AC DOB (Driver On Board) switching technology.

characteristic2.title: MJT and MCT technology to realize LED high voltage
characteristic2.des: Detailed technologies such as Multi Junction Technology (MJT) and Multi Chip Technology (MCT) are required to realize high voltage LED.
characteristic2.desMobile: Detailed technologies such as Multi Junction Technology (MJT) and Multi Chip Technology (MCT) are required to realize high voltage LED.

characteristic3.title: IC Switching technology to enhance efficiency
characteristic3.des: IC Switching technology can be driven by AC power and can increase efficiency. It is a technology that improves reliability by developing circuits that can withstand AC power and brings the efficiency of AC Direct DOB closer to that of SMPS.

applicationField.title: Application areas
applicationField.des: We provide a total solution including modules, engines, lenses, and heat dissipation structures.

acrich.remveveDriver: Eliminating the Driver is helpful in not only reducing the weight of the Driver, but also the weight of the entire system that mechanically protects the Driver.
acrich.driverOnBoard: Driver On Board enables development of thinner products, which helps design flexibility of the customers.​
acrich.smallComponents: Although SMPS requires several Components to drive the circuit, Acrich has simplified the entire circuit by Switching directly on the IC with Linear drive.​
acrich.smallComponentsMobile: Although SMPS requires several Components to drive the circuit, Acrich has simplified the entire circuit by Switching directly on the IC with Linear drive.​
acrich.fixtureDesign: The size is reduced by removing Driver Parts and instruments, and heat dissipation performance can be improved in accordance with Flat Design.

uv.introduction:
UV ray is a light energy with a shorter wavelength (200-400 nm) than visible light. As it is situated in the violet color domain of visible light, it is referred to as ultraviolet (UV) ray and is classified into 3 categories, namely, UVC, UVB and UVA according to its wavelength range.
This is clean and advanced UV LED technology that can be utilized for disinfection, purification and deodorization of water, air and surfaces.
uv.introductionMobile: UV ray is a light energy with a shorter wavelength (200-400 nm) than visible light. As it is situated in the violet color domain of visible light, it is referred to as ultraviolet (UV) ray and is classified into 3 categories, namely, UVC, UVB and UVA according to its wavelength range.

characteristic1.title: Energy Efficiency
characteristic1.des: UV LED is significantly more energy efficient than the existing mercury lamps and provides the same, if not higher, UV output.
characteristic1.des2: UV LED converts electrical energy into UV at a higher efficiency than mercury lamps, while mercury lamps generate heat energy in addition to UV, which results in energy losses. UV LED also emits UV light immediately when electric energy is supplied, thereby eliminating the need for warm-up or cooling time, which not only saves operating costs but also reduces carbon emissions due to energy savings in the process of UV uses.
characteristic1.desMobile:
UV LED is significantly more energy efficient than the existing mercury lamps and provides the same, if not higher, UV output.

UV LED converts electrical energy into UV at a higher efficiency than mercury lamps, while mercury lamps generate heat energy in addition to UV, which results in energy losses. UV LED also emits UV light immediately when electric energy is supplied, thereby eliminating the need for warm-up or cooling time, which not only saves operating costs but also reduces carbon emissions due to energy savings in the process of UV uses.

characteristic2.title: Long Lifetime
characteristic2.des:
UV LED can be used for prolonged period of time of more than 20,000 hours.
In contrast, mercury lamps have a limited lifespan and need to be replaced regularly, which signifies the need for temporary discontinuation of the production process.

characteristic3.title: Reduced heat generation and improved operational safety
characteristic3.des:
UV LEDs generate less heat than mercury lamps, reducing the risk of heat damage to produced products and increasing productivity.
They create a safer and more efficient working environment, preventing the risk of burns for workers

applicationField.title: Application areas
applicationField.des: UV LEDs are being applied in various fields, from household appliances to automotive and industrial equipment.

sunlight.introduction:
The most comfortable light and beneficial light is the light from the nature.
The world is now focusing on human centric lighting that mimics the natural light.​
sunlight.relationship: Since the creation of the earth 4.5 billion years ago, humans have evolved along with sunlight.
sunlight.relationshipMobile: Since the creation of the earth 4.5 billion years ago, humans have evolved along with sunlight.
sunlight.des1: As such, our DNA has evolved to be active during the day while the sun is shining and sleep in the dark at night after the sunset on a 24-hour day cycle. Under the sunlight, We release “serotonin” to feel energized under the sunlight during the day and “melatonin” to help us sleep soundly during the dark night. In fact, when more serotonin hormone is released by sunlight during the day, more melatonin secretion is activated during night, thereby making the 'sunlight' an essential component for generation of healthy biorhythm.
sunlight.des2: We spend more time under artificial light than we do in the natural light of the sun. For a healthy life, it's important to make good choices about the light we use throughout our daily live. The most comfortable and beneficial light for humans is the light that comes from nature. As such, the world is now focusing on human centric lighting that mimics natural light.
sunlight.solutions:
Human-Centric Lighting
Human-centric lighting is a lighting technology that mimics natural light to stabilize human biorhythms and promote comfort, health and well-being, and is a new concept that emerged in the professional lighting industry.

sunLike.introduction: SunLike reproduces a light spectrum that most closely resembles that of the natural light to provide light that is beneficial to humans.​
sunLike.subIntroduction:
Prolonged exposure to general lighting with excessive blue light increases the level of eye and body fatigue, and disrupts biorhythm.
SunLike reduces excessive blue light wavelengths and reproduces the natural light spectrum to the level that is same as that of the natural light.

effect1.label: Better Eye
effect1.title: Effective on the health of eyes for growing children and well as reduction of eye fatigue level.
effect1.des:
Do you think myopia is hereditary?
As the result of a survey conducted in 4 Asian countries, it was found that the rate of myopia in children has quadrupled in the last 50 years. In particular, Korea has the highest rate of manifestation of myopia in children in the world at 97%.
As we spend more time indoors and less time outdoors, use smartphones increasingly more along with greater study loads, the risk of developing myopia is increasing.

item1.label: Reduce eye fatigue
item1.title: By 4.3 times
item1.des:
Eye fatigue is reduced
when using natural light spectrum LED SunLike lighting.

item2.label: Improvement in eye comfort
item2.title: By 1.2 times
item2.des:
Eye comfort is improved
when using natural light spectrum LED SunLike lighting.

item3.label: Progression of myopia
item3.title: Slower myopia
item3.des: Experiment results that illustrated that natural spectrum LED SunLike lighting slows down the progression of myopia have been confirmed.

item4.label: Improvement of myopia
item4.title: Myopia improvement
item4.des: Experiment results that illustrated that natural spectrum LED SunLike lighting improves myopia have been confirmed.

item1.title: The Increasing Incidence of Myopia and Its Causes
item1.des: Excessive exposure to artificial lighting with strong blue light can destabilize the secretion of dopamine from the retina, leading to excessive eye growth and an increased risk of myopia, as the distance between the lens and the retina becomes greater. Natural light helps stabilize the dopamine rhythm in the eyes and inhibits excessive eye growth, thereby contributing to the prevention of myopia.

item2.highlight: [Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI)] Study on the Relationship Between Lighting and Myopia
item2.title: Progression of Myopia and Myopia Improvement

detail2.title: When using SunLike,
detail2.des: the progression of myopia slows down, the thickness of the choroid (the middle layer of the eye) increases, and the correction of ametropia (normal vision) occurs more rapidly. This indicates that SunLike lighting replicates a spectrum similar to natural light, playing a positive role for the eyes akin to natural sunlight, which helps to slow down the progression of myopia and aids in its recovery.

brand.title: Singapore Eye Research Institute, Study on the Effects of SunLike as a Countermeasure for Myopia (2020)
brand.des: Chicks, one of the animals with a structure most similar to that of humans' eyes, were subjected to a study where one eye was covered for two weeks to induce myopia. They were then exposed to fluorescent lighting and SunLike lighting for an additional two weeks to compare the myopia recovery effects. This study aimed to evaluate the impact of SunLike LEDs on eye growth and the development of myopia.

item3.highlight: [University of Basel, Switzerland] Experiment on Eye Comfort Levels Based on Lighting
item3.title: Proven to be 1.2 times better quality of light.

detail2.title: Measurement of Light Comfort Index
detail2.des: In an experiment measuring the ‘Light Comfort Index,‘ which combines ‘brightness level‘ and ‘color temperature,‘ SunLike lighting has been proven to provide light quality more than 1.2 times better than conventional lighting.

brand.title: University of Basel, Study on the Effects of Natural Light LED on Eye Comfort, Melatonin, Mood, Alertness Performance, and Sleep, 2019
brand.des: The study was conducted on 15 participants aged 19 to 35 with normal eye conditions and no glasses, over a period of 2-3 weeks, focusing on experiments related to eye comfort, melatonin levels, mood, alertness performance, and brain wave activity during sleep.

item4.highlight: [Seoul National University College of Medicine] Experiment on the Relationship Between Lighting and Eye Fatigue
item4.title: Eye fatigue reduced by 4.3 times.

detail2.title: Experiment Between SunLike Users and Conventional Lighting Users
detail2.des: In experiments regarding eye fatigue, blurred vision, and light sensitivity, SunLike users showed a reduction in eye fatigue of over 4.3 times compared to users of conventional lighting.

brand.title: Seoul National University College of Medicine, Study on the Effects of Natural Light LED on Nighttime Sleep and Eye Discomfort, 2018
brand.des: The study involved 34 participants aged 20 to 49, divided into two groups of 17, using conventional lighting and SunLike lighting. Experiments were conducted on eye fatigue, blurred vision, light sensitivity, speed of falling asleep, speed of waking up in the morning, heart rate measured through electrocardiograms during sleep, and the activation of the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems.

effect5.des: When it is used living rooms, children's rooms, inside the car, reading rooms, skincare centers, co-shared offices and other types of offices, etc., it is possible to establish environment that is comfortable in overall by lowering the eye fatigue and enabling return to one’s natural biorhythm by ensuring that there is no excessive glare.

effect6.label: Natural Color
effect6.title: Enables accurate representation the innate true colors of objects
effect6.des:
Unlike viewing objects under the sunlight, ordinary indoor LED lighting causes the colors to appear distorted due to diffuse reflection arising from the effects of the blue light.
SunLike enables reproduction of the color rendering index (CRI), which indicates the feel of the colors one sees, to a CRI-97 level that is almost identical to sunlight (CRI 100), allowing one to see the innate true colors even under artificial lighting.

In addition, blue light, a specific wavelength band, has been reduced to that of the sunlight to not only help one to see texts more clearly, but also reduces glare and fatigue on the eyes.

item2.title: Color Reproduction of SunLike
item2.des: SunLike has been evaluated as a high-quality light that closely resembles natural light in the UL Color Fidelity Rating, achieving the top rating of Diamond.

detail2.title: UL Certification
detail2.des: The UL mark is a global certification mark granted to products that have passed safety and performance testing and evaluation. SunLike achieved a Color Rendering Index (CRI) of 97, closely resembling natural light (100), during UL's performance assessment. Notably, in the color fidelity category, which evaluates similarity to natural light, SunLike met the requirement of Rf 95 or higher, making it the first LED light source to be registered with the Diamond rating in the industry. SunLike's unique technology that reproduces the same spectrum as natural light sets a standard for the quality of light.

note1.label: * Color Rendering Index (CRI) :
note1.des: A measure that indicates how well light represents the original colors of objects, expressed on a scale from 0 to 100.

note2.label: * UL Evaluation Criteria :
note2.des: Diamond: Rf ≥ 95/ Platinum Rf ≥ 90, Rf, h1 ≥ 90/ Gold: Rf ≥ 85, Rf, h1 ≥ 85

note3.label: * Rf :
note3.des: A measure that indicates how faithfully light compares to sunlight, expressed on a scale from 0 to 100.

detail.des:

The Grevin Museum Paris, a French wax museum, chose SunLike due to its ability to illustrate the texture of costumes and natural skin expressions, which is difficult to achieve with ordinary lighting.
In addition, SunLike has been applied in large museums in the world including illumination of wall murals in Pompeii, Italy and the Royal Palace Art Museum in Milan, etc.

character.desc:
UV 'Violeds', a distinguished proprietary technology in UV LED, only utilizes light without any use of harmful chemicals to design optimal wavelength, angle, distance, time and luminosity and provide solutions to a variety of industrial fields for sterilization and disinfection (UVC), skin regeneration (UVB), air and water purification, insect attraction and promotion of plant growth. 
With eco-friendly, low-power and ozone-free advantages, it is a market expected to quickly replace the existing mercury lamp market by addressing its weaknesses.
